wikitext.*:
'''''ráma''''' (pl. '''rámar''', '''rámali''') is a [[Quenya]] word meaning "wing" and poetically "branch" of a tree.
==Etymology==
[[PQ]] ''[[râmâ]]'' from [[root]] [[RAM]]<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry '''RAM'''</ref>
==Other forms==
*''rāma''<ref name=pe12>{{PE|22}}</ref>
*''rhāma''<ref name=pe12/>
==Cognates==
*Sindarin ''[[raw]]''<ref>{{PE|17}}</ref>
*[[Gnomish]] ''[[ram (Gnomish)|ram]]''<ref>{{PE|11}}</ref>
==Examples==
{{quote|Yéni únótimë ve rámar aldaron! ('long years numberless as the wings of trees!')<ref name=Namarie>{{RGEO|Namarie}}, line 2</ref>|''[[Namárië]]''}}
*''[[Eärrámë]]'' (Sea-Wing)<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entries "AYAR-/AIR-", "RAM-"</ref>
*''[[Númerrámar]]'' ("West-wings")<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2192932697.html|articlename=Q. ''Númerrámar'' pn.|website=Eldamo|accessed=21 February 2024}}</ref>
==Inspiration==
In [[Latin]], ''[[Wiktionary:ramus#Latin|rāmus]]'' means "branch"<ref>Charlton T. Lewis, Charles Short, ''A Latin Dictionary''</ref> which mirrors the poetic usage of ''rámar'' as "wings (of trees)" > "branches" in ''Namárië''<ref name=Namarie/>
{{references}}
